thread.title: Australia Shares Down Sharply; Energy Stocks Lead Decline
thread.title_full: Australia Shares Down Sharply; Energy Stocks Lead Decline - WSJ

author: Robb Stewart
title: Australia Shares Down Sharply; Energy Stocks Lead Decline
text: 0304 GMT [Dow Jones] Australian stocks are down sharply at lunchtime, eating into rallies the previous two days even after positive employment figures. It comes after market sentiment reversed during the U.S. trading session, pulling shares there down for the day. The ASX 200 is down 2.2% at 5104.7, with energy stocks leading broad losses following a drop in crude-oil prices. Commonwealth Securities says 1.2 billion shares had been traded by lunch, worth about A$3.3 billion. Among energy counters, Woodside (WPL.AU) is down 2%, Oil Search (OSH.AU) is 3.2% lower and Santos (STO.AU) is 3.9% weaker. Origin Energy is down... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In
